title: George Wood
text: I’m a Moore-Sloan Faculty Fellow in the Center for Data Science at New York University, where I work on causal inference in observational settings and teach Responsible Data Science. Find out more.

title: George Wood
text:
I’m a data scientist and R developer with a background in social science. My work focuses on causal inference in observational settings, with application to criminal justice and gun violence. I have a longstanding interest in sports analytics and developing data science tools.
 

Education


Nuffield College, University of Oxford
PhD in Sociology

Research Areas: Social Networks, Statistical Inference on Networks, Gun Violence
Funded by Economic and Social Research Council



2017




St Cross College, University of Oxford
MSc in Sociology


2012




University of Sheffield
BA in Sociology with First-Class Honours


2011




Experience


New York University
Moore-Sloan Faculty Fellow, Center for Data Science


2020–present




Northwestern University
Postdoctoral Fellow, Institute for Policy Research

Supervised by Andrew Papachristos



2019–2020




Yale University
Postdoctoral Associate, Institution for Social and Policy Studies

Supervised by Andrew Papachristos



2017–2019




Teaching
New York University


DS-GA 1017 and DS-UA 202 Responsible Data Science

Technical course that tackles issues of data quality, algorithmic fairness,  transparency of data and algorithms, ethics, privacy, and data protection.
Find out more about the course here.



2021, 2022




DS-UA 111 Data Science for Everyone

Flagship course at the Center for Data Science.
Designed for students without prior statistics or programming experience.



2021, 2022
